page.title: 19School Residential Trip
page.content: Our class of 10 and 11 year old children at Sandhills School went to Poole for a five day trip in March 1985. We used 2 minibuses to get there.On the way we stopped at Bucklers Hard where big ships were made in the 18th Century. We stayed at Canute House on Poole Quay. We had a boat trip on the harbour, a trip to Corfe Castle and Studland Beach, a visit to an aquarium and a look at the Georgian houses. We heard stories about smugglers.We walked along the quay studying the boats etc. On the return journey we stopped at Salisbury Cathedral and climbed up the tower. Everyone had enjoyed the trip. At school we have made a book about our visit and we have made paintings, screen prints, lino cut prints, batiks, scraper board pictures, sewn and woven pictures of boats, fish, Corfe, Old Harry Rocks, Georgian houses etc.
